repnme.cdata!: Nepal - Basic and Primary Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is assessed
            as satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The project
            was well designed, addressed key educational issues, with
            relevant, and clearly defined objectives, and had a direct
            link to the Government's medium-term plans in the
            sector. The lessons address: 1) Quality, which can be
            achieved by focusing on the acquisition of basic learning
            skills, and introducing an integrated approach at the school
            level, to promote student learning, teacher performance, and
            school development. Although the project did succeed in
            improving the delivery of quality of education, it did not
            however improve substantial learning, and achievement of
            students. Hence, the following operation is designed to
            adapt, and expand the school cluster model, to improve
            teaching, and learning, and will strengthen curriculum
            implementation. 2) Access, which can be improved through
            strategies targeting the neediest, to increase participation
            in education, and, interventions to increase girls, and
            out-of-school children enrollment. Further improvements
            would come through the appointment of female teachers,
            provision of textbooks, and scholarships, in addition to
            literacy programs, and strengthened support for teachers. 3)
            Institutional development, should be integrated into the
            education system, by reinforcing stability of staff,
            technical capacity building, and professional accountability.

18154792.trustfund: TF024950-INDIAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND,TF020255-PHRD-POPULATION & HEALTH PROJECT,TF025190-BASIC AND PRIMARY EDUCATION

repnme.cdata!: Nepal - Basic and Primary Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's main objectives are
            to:  (i) improve the quality of primary education; (ii)
            increase equitable access to primary schooling; and (iii)
            strengthen the management of the formal and non-formal
            primary education delivery system.  The project consists of
            three components.  The first component, designed to increase
            the quality of primary education, will:  (a) simplify the
            primary school curriculum and make it more relevant; (b)
            provide improved teacher instructional materials, textbooks
            and supplementary materials; and (c) institutionalize a
            teacher supervision, support and training system.  The
            second component, designed to improve access to educational
            resources, will: (a) strengthen the non-formal primary
            education and literacy programs; (b) offer an increased
            opportunity to receive a basic education to girls, the very
            poor, and those in remote areas; and (c) construct and/or
            renovate primary school classrooms to accommodate the
            increase in enrollment.  The third component, designed to
            improve the institutional development of the subsector,
            will:  (a) strengthen the Ministry of Education's
            capacity to plan, manage and monitor its formal and
            non-formal primary education program; (b) assist in the
            development of its capacity to coordinate and manage
            donor-aided projects; and (c) improve the design of
            efficient classroom facilities.
